ca.uqac.lif.fs

Interface FileSystem

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Base64FileSystem, Chroot, FilterFileSystem, FlatFileSystem, FloppyDisk, FtpConnection, HardDisk, JarFile, Mirror, NoopFileSystem, PersistentFileSystem, RamDisk, ReadOnlyFileSystem, ReadZipFile, TempFolder, ThrottledFileSystem, WriteZipFile

    public interface FileSystem
    Abstraction of elementary read and write operations over a file system.
    Author:
    Sylvain Hall√©

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  FileSystem.OpenState
      Enumeration representing the three possible states of a file system.

    • Method Detail

      • open

        void open()
   throws FileSystemException
        Starts the interaction with the file system. All operations invoked on a file system will throw a FileSystemException if called before this method.
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - Thrown if the interaction with the file system cannot be started

      • ls

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> ls()
                             throws FileSystemException
        Lists all the files and folders in the current directory.
        Returns:
        The list of files and folders
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - Thrown if the operation could not be performed for some reason

      • ls

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> ls(java.lang.String path)
                             throws FileSystemException
        Lists all the files and folders in a given directory.
        Parameters:
        path - The path from which to list files
        Returns:
        The list of files and folders
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - Thrown if the operation could not be performed for some reason

      • isDirectory

        boolean isDirectory(java.lang.String path)
             throws FileSystemException
        Determines if the resource pointed to by a given path corresponds to a directory.
        Parameters:
        path - The path
        Returns:
        true if the resource exists and is a directory, false otherwise
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - Thrown if the operation could not be performed for some reason

      • isFile

        boolean isFile(java.lang.String path)
        throws FileSystemException
        Determines if the resource pointed to by a given path corresponds to a file.
        Parameters:
        path - The path
        Returns:
        true if the resource exists and is a file, false otherwise
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - Thrown if the operation could not be performed for some reason

      • getSize

        long getSize(java.lang.String path)
      throws FileSystemException
        Gets the size of a file.
        Parameters:
        path - The path corresponding to the file
        Returns:
        The size in bytes
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - Thrown if the operation could not be performed for some reason

      • writeTo

        java.io.OutputStream writeTo(java.lang.String filename)
                      throws FileSystemException
        Writes data to a file. The method provides an OutputStream to which data can be printed. The data is guaranteed to be committed to the file only when the print stream is closed. Whether data is written before that moment depends on the actual file system implementation.
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file to which data is to be written
        Returns:
        An output stream open on the file. If the method successfully returns, it guarantees that this stream is not null
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - Thrown if the operation could not be performed for some reason

      • readFrom

        java.io.InputStream readFrom(java.lang.String filename)
                      throws FileSystemException
        Reads data from a file. The method provides an InputStream from which data can be read. Consumers of this input stream have the responsibility to close the stream after usage.
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file to which data is to be written
        Returns:
        A print stream open on the file. If the method successfully returns, it guarantees that this stream is not null
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - Thrown if the operation could not be performed for some reason

      • chdir

        void chdir(java.lang.String path)
    throws FileSystemException
        Changes the current directory.
        Parameters:
        path - The directory to change to. The string can contain a path relative to the current directory.
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - Thrown if the operation could not be performed for some reason

      • pushd

        void pushd(java.lang.String path)
    throws FileSystemException
        Parameters:
        path - The directory to change to. The string can contain a path relative to the current directory.
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - Thrown if the operation could not be performed for some reason

      • popd

        void popd()
   throws FileSystemException
        Changes the current directory to the one before the last call to chdir(String) or pushd(String).
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - Thrown if the operation could not be performed for some reason

      • mkdir

        void mkdir(java.lang.String path)
    throws FileSystemException
        Creates a directory if it does not exist.
        Parameters:
        path - The directory to create. The string can contain a path relative to the current directory.
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - Thrown if the operation could not be performed for some reason

      • rmdir

        void rmdir(java.lang.String path)
    throws FileSystemException
        Deletes a directory and all its contents.
        Parameters:
        path - The directory to delete
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - Thrown if the operation could not be performed for some reason

      • delete

        void delete(java.lang.String path)
     throws FileSystemException
        Deletes a directory and all its contents.
        Parameters:
        path - The directory to delete
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - Thrown if the operation could not be performed for some reason

      • pwd

        java.lang.String pwd()
              throws FileSystemException
        Retrieves the current working directory, relative to the root of the file system.
        Returns:
        A string representing the current working directory
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - Thrown if the operation could not be performed for some reason

      • close

        void close()
    throws FileSystemException
        Stops the interaction with the file system. All operations invoked on a file system will throw a FileSystemException if called after this method.
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - Thrown if an error occurred while stopping the interaction with the file system
